hiveArticle.title: Did you notice today Steemit Family that your blog posts are NOT AUTO UPVOTED BY YOURSELF any longer?   I bet some of you did not notice this change in code today!!
hiveArticle.body:
##### <center>
 https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://steemitimages.com/DQmf3n3rFPUdGoavakuzpnzfsbk1DbjaM1uNPyuDmDArsS8/image.png

----

Normally when you write and post a blog, the default setting is to the checkbox  here where my cursor is, in the image below, being checked where you write and format your post-- so you automatically UV (upvote) your own post.

----

![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmYPu3dKpr4r1d3MeB73EYWsXsQZupXSFRzEiMnSho8fqF/image.png)

----

As you can  see, it  is the little checkbox that says **Upvote Post** right below where you have the REWARDS option drop down box.  It is either a glitch, in the code, or the code has been changed -- so please pay attention to this.

I've been on here 11 months and I have about 800 blog posts up and it has always been auto-checked to auto upvote my post when I publish a post. 

I'm not sure why it has become unchecked now, but the norm is to UV your post when you publish.   For people with a little more (or a lot more) SP (Steem Power) -- this is a significant change and makes a big difference.  

All my posts y-day were fine, so overnight, something changed last nite or very early today in my EST zone, anyways.
